page.title: 18Granada Service Station
page.content: On 13 June Louise Jones and I interviewed the manageress of the Leigh Delamere Service Station. The Services are owned by{Granada.}They sell about 3.5 million gallons of {petrol}a year. About 16,000{cars}stop a week but it can go up to 129,000 in the summer season. There are four different sorts of{jobs,}general caterer, shop assistant, forecourt attendant and cleaner. There are 7 outside cleaners and 20 inside cleaners. The favourite{drink}is tea and the favourite item of{food}is sausages. They sell 5,500 pounds (weight) of chips, 15,000 pounds of sausages, 6,000 pounds of tomatoes, 2,000 pounds of baked beans and 80,000 tea bags per week. In the winter they have 200{employees}and in the summer 300. by Jacqueline Harrison
